data.title: Frank Castillo – We are here to serve others, not ourselves
data.text:
Election Day: Nov 5, 2024.

Early Voting: Oct 21 – Nov 1.

As the sitting UISD School District Board Member for District 7, it is a privilege and honor to represent our constituents.

Our community is a dynamic area with taxpayers from all walks of life. It is our duty to listen to all about their ideas and concerns plus advocate for them.

Our main aspiration is to ensure that ALL students learn and reach their fullest potential and development.

Your only voice to stand for good governance and represent our students, teachers, parents and our staff at our Board Meetings –

Voted for staff and teacher raises every year – Recognizes Perfect Attendance in every school in District7 – Worked with staff to establish shuttle bus transportation for Elias Herrera Middle School –

Worked with staff to establish the Aftercare School Program at San Isidro Elementary School – Helped our retirees by making it easier to qualify for UISD retirement – Allowed school staff to work efficiently and effectively without micromanaging their duties and responsibilities.

Frank has a Master of Public Administration from Texas A&M International University. His work experience has been in the field of mental health, criminal justice and juvenile justice. He understands the value of listening to “both sides of the story.”

Frank is a family man that enjoys time with his family and children. He has one granddaughter.

Frank is a member of (AFSCME), (TPEA), Pi Sigma Alpha (Political Science Honor Society), Sigma Alpha Pi (National Honor Society for Leadership & Success), and is a TRS Retiree He currently serves as the UISD representative to the Webb County Appraisal District Board.
